Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a single playing card that has a value, suit, and a face of a normal card deck.
    Version:
    23 Apr 2019
    Author:
    Austin Lowery

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card()
        The no-args constructor creates an Ace of Hearts by default.

      • Card

        public Card(Card other)
        The copy constructor creates a deep copy of a passed in Card object.
        Parameters:
        Card - a card to copy

      • Card

        public Card(int inValue,
            char inSuit,
            java.lang.String inFace)
        This constructor takes in a value, a suit, and a face. The value passed must be between 1 and 13 inclusively. The passed in value goes unused if the face is defined. For example, if some valid number, n, is passed in, and a recognized face is passed in, say "King", the value will become to 13 and the face will be a King. If the face is unrecognized, the number will determine what face was put in.
        Parameters:
        int - the value of the card (goes unused if the face is defined)
        char - the suit of the card; becomes a Heart card if left undefined
        String - the face of the card (takes presedence over the value if defined)

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Card other)
        Compares two cards using their values. It will return -1 if the caller is less than the passed in card object, 0 if the caller is equal, and 1 if the caller is more.
        Parameters:
        Card - card to compare to the caller
        Returns:
        int - value that tells of the comparison

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Card other)
        Compares two cards using their values and suit.
        Parameters:
        Card - card to compare to the caller
        Returns:
        boolean - value that tells of it's equavalence
